body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3831,"title":"NYACK PUBLIC SCHOOLS WILL BE CLOSED THROUGH MAY 15, IN RESPONSE TO COVID (19). Please read more for complete Updates:","body":"
On Monday, April 13th - our Tech Help Desk has been updated in response to the volume of tech assistance needed by our families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole. If you have not received a District-issued device and need one for your child's Remote Learning Plan, call the TECH HELP DESK at 845-353-7075. Or, 

Use this NEW TECH HELP DESK FORM for quick-access to assistance. Simply click on the link, fill out the form and submit. A tech assistant will contact you within 24 hours:





Nyack Family and Student Technology Help Desk

Soporte Técnico y de Apoyo Digital para la Familia y Estudiantes del Distrito Escolar de Nyack

Sistèm pou Ede Fanmi ak Elèv yo nan Teknoloji




On Tuesday, April 7th, a letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to parent/guardians of grades 7-12 students and included the NYS Education Department (NYSED) cancellation of June 2020 Regents Exams. The letter contains guidance on modifications to requirements for students to graduate and earn their high school diplomas, credentials and endorsements. It has been posted and emailed. Please read for full details.

On Monday, April 6th, The NYS Dept. of Education "Acts on a Series of Emergency Regulations to Ease the Burdens of Educators Students and Professionals in the Wake of COVID-10 Pandemic" http://www.nysed.gov/news/2020/board-regents-acts-series-emergency-regulations-ease-burdens-educators-students-and-0

April 6th FRC Video https://share.icloud.com/photos/0okjDTLU4wdzJSeXGwXXfjgDg

On Wednesday, April 1, a letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to all District families, including the announcement that as per Gov. Cuomo's Executive Order 202.11, students will continue to work remotely with their teachers during April 9-17. Food distribution to families will also continue.

Nyack Public Schools Parent Guide to Remote Learning has been posted and sent to all District families in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole. 

March 28 Guidance Dept. Video: https://www.icloud.com/photos/#0X8y38-HyHnc1QbQfILXIOstw

On Friday, March 27, a letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to District families including the Governor's waiver of the 180-day mandate April 15th.

March 21 VIDEO to our School Community https://share.icloud.com/photos/0x2kDaZALGWUYXMFj0Eb2ONhg

On Thursday, March 19, letter from Dr. Montesano was sent to all District families containing the following:


Thursday, March 19th marked the first day of our District Education Continuity Plan

The Education Continuity Plan (K-12) is posted in the Announcement Box.

Electronic versions of the ELEMENTARY PACKETS FOR STUDENTS in grades K-5 IS POSTED for Days 1-15 of School Closure in the announcement box on each elementary school website, listed by grade level.

The School Meal Program is provided at 2 locations for students with Free/Reduced Meals on Monday - Friday at: Nyack Center b/w 9:30-1:00pm; and Waldron Terrace parking lot from a mobile unit between 10:00-11:00am.

A Guidance Department Resource Page has been created for families.


THE DISTRICT's TECH HELP DESK number is 845-353-7075

We will continue to send updates via robo-call, email and text messaging to all District families. All update letters from the Superintendent's office are posted in the District's website announcement box, for reference.

Thank you for your continued collaboration as we work together to keep all families informed and connected during this unique and challenging time. 

Stay Nyack-Strong!","dateStart":"2020-04-16T21:06:16Z","baseGroupName":"Nyack Public Schools","hash":"+EijvZ/2lZoTFUNBTj4ytIJnSJUqoMONy9hVfo2id7Q=","updateDate":"2020-04-16T21:06:17Z"}];

img.div: Building Bridges for today's students to cross into tomorrow's world with Equity, Innovation & Optimism

div.h3: Our Parent Guide to Remote Learning, the Education Continuity Plan for students and letters sent during school closure are posted HERE...

div.p: All staff in Nyack Public Schools are responding to the educational needs of our students during this unique and challenging time. Thank you for your continued partnership to keep our school community connected and safe.

p.strong: The NEW Parent Guide to Remote Learning has been published and posted for use by all NPS families and staff. It is attached, below, in English, Spanish and Haitian Creole for your reference. Please refer to it for important protocols, expectations and resources to use during the extended school closure.
The District-wide Education Continuity Plan for all students, K-12, is being utilized during the COVID-19 school closure.
Students are expected to work on daily assignments from this plan. Teachers are holding virtual office hours Monday - Friday from 9:30am - 12:00pm.

strong.em: A summary of the District-wide Education Continuity Plan is posted below, along with all letters from Dr. Montesano that have been sent to all District families and staff, for your convenience.

li.a: 19 de Marzo Actualizacion Importante en espanol.pdf
April 1 2020 Letter from Dr Montesano to Parent-Guardians ESPANOL.pdf
April 1 2020 Letter from Dr Montesano to Parent-Guardians HAITIAN CREOLE.pdf
April 1 2020 Letter from Dr Montesano to Parent-Guardians.pdf
April 14 SURVEY for Rockland ER Worker and Essential Workers.pdf
April 7 Letter to Grades 7-12 Parent Guardians Regarding NYS Regents Exams.pdf
Guia de Aprendizaje Remoto Para Padres 2020.pdf
March 16 Letter from Superintendent 6C-19 rev ENGLISH.pdf
Nyack Plan de Continuidad de Educacion K-12.pdf
Nyack Public Schools Remote Learning Guide for Parents 2020.pdf

div.h3: Letters from the Superintendent's Office posted prior to school closure are posted in this announcement box for your reference.

div.p: These letters from the Superintendent of Schools, along with a Parent Guide to Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19), were posted prior to school closure due to COVID-19. They are being stored, here, along with this helpful video for your reference: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0mUrdZGSdAE.

p.strong: Our administration remains in contact with the Rockland County Department of Health, the New York State Health Department and the New York State Education Department, and will continue to monitor the situation to ensure plans are in place and protocols are followed to keep all students and staff members safe and updated with the latest information.

li.a: Carta del Superintendente de Escuelas - 05 de Marzo.pdf

div.p: more details, including time confirmation and Zoom Mtg info, TBD

section.h3: Hilltop Gallery Reception Valley Cottage Exhibit

div.p: THE BOE TRUSTEE ELECTION AND BUDGET VOTE HAS BEEN DELAYED DUE TO COVID-19. ADDITIONAL DETAILS PENDING AND ONCE CONFIRMED WILL BE REVISED AND POSTED.

em.strong: "Just as we believe that all children are capable learners, we must “turn the mirror inward” and put focus on our own continued learning to build the human capacity and will to make a difference. When we understand that all children are our children and we see each child pursuing their full potential, we will see a brighter future."

div.p: A Message from the Superintendent for the 2019-20 School Year: Sixty five years after Supreme Court’s decision in Brown vs. BOE, America’s schools are more segregated by race and class (U.S. Govt. Accountability Office, 2016). Our Nation’s racial and ethnic composition is rapidly changing. Among people aged eighty and over in the 2010 U.S. Census, more than 80% were white, but only 52% were white among those aged 5 or younger (Ferguson, 2013). Being mindful of what data trends indicate, what are the implications for our Nation if we are unable to close a persistent achievement gap?

In Nyack Public Schools, our fundamental goal is to prepare every child to develop their full potential for living in our society of today and tomorrow. This moral imperative guides a shift in thinking we are compelled to make if we are to realize the success of each child. As we deepen our collective understanding of equity, we are asking an essential question: How do we work together to establish a culture that embraces diversity, respects all cultures, and ensures the development and implementation of educational programs that maximize academic achievement of all students regardless of race or socio-economics?

As we face a new school year, we are optimistic about changes and challenges it is sure to bring. We ask all members of our school community to join us in envisioning equity together. We will continue to take risks by closely examining the role we each play in changing a system that has allowed unacceptable disproportionality of outcomes, opportunity and achievement to persist within this District. Just as we believe that all children are capable learners, we must “turn the mirror inward” and put focus on our own continued learning to build the human capacity and will to make a difference. When we understand that all children are our children and we see each child pursuing their full potential, we will see a brighter future.
Join Us in a shared vision of excellence in education with equity, innovation and optimism.
Tell us what you think. We are listening and want to keep our community engaged in authentic communication. Let's Talk!
